definition: clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: Soldiers in camouflage banged on the door, then shot at it, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，穿着迷彩服的士兵大聲捶門，然後朝門開槍。

sentences.english: I've seen the uniform change from olive drab to camouflage (retired before getting the scatter pattern).
sentences.chinese: 見過從橄欖色到迷彩服等一些列軍裝。

sentences.english: Soldiers in fatigues loitered by the vehicles or slept inside.
sentences.chinese: 身穿迷彩服的士兵或在車內徘徊，或在裏面睡覺。

sentences.english: Some of them even wore them with their camouflage combat smocks .
sentences.chinese: 有些人還穿着迷彩服佩帶勳章。

sentences.english: Teams of paramilitaries in camouflage gear search through cars and stop lorries.
sentences.chinese: 身着迷彩服的準軍事小組搜索車輛，並阻攔貨車。

sentences.english: The sleeves of his camouflage shirt are cut off and his combat boots are untied.
sentences.chinese: 迷彩服的袖子被剪掉了，戰鬥靴也解開了。

sentences.english: Lee, 21 Infantry Division in the inspection, the specially dressed in camouflage fatigues.
sentences.chinese: 李明博在視察第21步兵師團時，還特地身着迷彩服。

definition: to subdue/to check/to bring under control/(in former times) what one is allowed to wear depending on social status/uniform (army, party, school etc)/livery (for company employees)/CL:套[tao4]
fully armed/armed to the teeth/fig. fully equipped
